intro: Calotis cuneifolia var. biaristata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved calotis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in coastal regions and can thrive in full sun. This variety is noted for its resilience and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
